doom.driver: General shot in Moscow conscious after surgery, Russian media say. Lt Gen Vladimir Alexeyev was shot several times inside his apartment block on Friday morning.
doom.summary: A Russian Lt General takes bullets to the torso and lives—which in Moscow's recent history is either a sign of improving medical care or deteriorating internal security. The Kremlin's internal fractures are apparently now expressed through small arms fire, which is theater-adjacent to actual doom but mostly just sad.

factors.name: Geopolitics
factors.detail: Russian military brass being shot in their homes suggests internal power struggles, though assassination attempts on senior officers are a known pattern rather than a new threshold.

factors.name: Governance
factors.detail: Russian state capacity to protect senior generals from violence within Moscow proper remains questionable.

factors.name: Wild Card
factors.detail: A documentary's audience score manipulation is trivial compared to actual bullets, though it does highlight information ecosystem decay.

factors.name: AI Capability
factors.detail: No AI-related threat signals in today's headlines.

dawn.driver: France's homegrown open source online office suite
dawn.blurb: DIGITAL SOVEREIGNTY RISES: OPEN SOURCE POWERS FORWARD
dawn.summary: While geopolitical tensions dominate headlines, France's launch of a homegrown open-source office suite signals a powerful countertrend: nations and communities building technological independence together. This isn't isolation—it's collaborative resilience. Open-source movements prove that innovation thrives when knowledge is shared, not gatekept, and that alternatives to surveillance-laden platforms are genuinely possible.

factors.name: Technology
factors.detail: Open-source office suite demonstrates viable alternatives to corporate monopolies exist and attract significant developer attention (253+ points, 135+ comments on Hacker News).

factors.name: Cooperation
factors.detail: Global open-source communities collaborating across borders to build shared digital infrastructure, proving technology can unite rather than divide.

factors.name: Human Spirit
factors.detail: Developers choosing to invest energy in public-good software reflects growing values alignment around privacy, sovereignty, and collective benefit.

factors.name: Wild Card
factors.detail: Community enthusiasm (253 points indicates strong organic interest) shows grassroots demand for ethical tech alternatives is real and growing.

factors.name: Science
factors.detail: Transparent, peer-reviewed approach to software development mirrors scientific method—reproducibility, auditability, and shared discovery.
